dt.t: a score of honorary degrees and … other {wi}kudos{/wi}
rarely hear that kind of {wi}kudo{/wi} to men anymore

pt: Some commentators hold that since {it}kudos{/it} is a singular word it cannot be used as a plural and that the word {it}kudo{/it} is impossible. But {it}kudo{/it} does exist; it is simply one of the most recent words created by back-formation from another word misunderstood as a plural. {it}Kudos{/it} was introduced into English in the 19th century; it was used in contexts where a reader unfamiliar with Greek could not be sure whether it was singular or plural. By the 1920s it began to appear as a plural, and about 25 years later {it}kudo{/it} began to appear. It may have begun as a misunderstanding, but then so did {it}cherry{/it} and {it}pea.{/it}
